{
    "tiddlers": {
        "$:/plugins/fk/soundcite/customization": {
            "title": "$:/plugins/fk/soundcite/customization",
            "created": "20200611000000000",
            "text": "You can change how SoundCite clips appear in the browser by overriding the CSS rules. The CSS classes which are applied to a SoundCite clip are

* `soundcite` (from the moment the page loads)
* `soundcite-loaded` (as soon as the sound has been loaded and is playable)
* `soundcite-play` (as soon as the sound has been loaded, until the sound is playing and after it is paused or stops)
* `soundcite-pause` (while the sound is playing)

You can see the default styles in the [[$:/plugins/fk/soundcite/soundcite-style]] tiddler.

For example, change the background by writing the following to a tiddler tagged `$:/tags/Stylesheet` and with type `text/css`:

```
.soundcite-loaded {
  background: rgba(195,69,40,.1)!important;
}
```

Note that to support animating progress as a clip plays, there is a different process for changing the color of the clip. You set it using JavaScript. Write the following to a tiddler tagged `$:/tags/RawMarkup` and with type `text/html`:

```
<script type="text/javascript">
  SOUNDCITE_CONFIG = {
    background_color: "#c34528"
  }
</script>
```

You can use any CSS hex color, but named colors are not supported. The transparency is not changeable through this setting.

If you want to take more control, you can define your own function for updating the playing element. Write the following to a tiddler as above:

```
<script type="text/javascript">
  var SOUNDCITE_CONFIG = {
    update_playing_element: function(el, percentage) {
      el.setAttribute("style", ''
        + 'background: -webkit-linear-gradient(bottom, rgba(195,69,40,.15)' + percentage + '%, rgba(195,69,40,.05)' + (percentage + 1) + '%);'
        + 'background: linear-gradient(to top, rgba(195,69,40,.15)' + percentage + '%, rgba(195,69,40,.05)' + (percentage + 1) + '%);'
    );
  }
}
</script>
```
"

        "$:/plugins/fk/soundcite/developing": {
            "title": "$:/plugins/fk/soundcite/developing",
            "created": "20200916000000000",
            "text": "The source code of this plugin is available at [[https://gitlab.com/fkohrt/tw5-soundcite]] under the MIT license. Different terms apply to the third party software it uses.

The SoundCite library is available at [[https://github.com/NUKnightLab/soundcite]] under the Mozilla Public License 2.0.

Popcorn.js is available at [[https://github.com/mozilla/popcorn-js]] under the MIT license.

Newer versions of the SoundCloud JavaScript SDK are available at [[https://github.com/soundcloud/soundcloud-javascript]] under the MIT license.

This plugin needs and includes Tobias Beer's [[script|https://tobibeer.github.io/tw/enable-js/#%24%3A%2F.tb%2Fmacros%2Fscript]] macro because SoundCite only initializes relevant sections once, while TiddlyWiki doesn't always retain already loaded content (e. g. the tab macro, which has the `retain` parameter though). It is therefore necessary to insert some initialization JavaScript code with each inserted SoundCite audio.

This plugin needs to disable the Camel Case Wiki Links because otherwise the inserted JavaScript code get's messed up.

        "$:/plugins/fk/soundcite/soundcite-style": {
            "text": "/* soundcite - v0.5.1 - 2017-07-10
 * Copyright (c) 2017 Tyler J. Fisher and Northwestern University Knight Lab
 */

/*PLAYER CHROME*/

@-webkit-keyframes spin {
	from { -webkit-transform: rotate(0deg); opacity: 0.4; }
	50%  { -webkit-transform: rotate(180deg); opacity: 1; }
	to   { -webkit-transform: rotate(360deg); opacity: 0.4; }
}

@-moz-keyframes spin {
	from { -moz-transform: rotate(0deg); opacity: 0.4; }
	50%  { -moz-transform: rotate(180deg); opacity: 1; }
	to   { -moz-transform: rotate(360deg); opacity: 0.4; }
}

@-ms-keyframes spin {
	from { -ms-transform: rotate(0deg); opacity: 0.4; }
	50%  { -ms-transform: rotate(180deg); opacity: 1; }
	to   { -ms-transform: rotate(360deg); opacity: 0.4; }
}

@-o-keyframes spin {
	from { -o-transform: rotate(0deg); opacity: 0.4; }
	50%  { -o-transform: rotate(180deg); opacity: 1; }
	to   { -o-transform: rotate(360deg); opacity: 0.4; }
}

@keyframes spin {
	from { transform: rotate(0deg); opacity: 0.2; }
	50%  { transform: rotate(180deg); opacity: 1; }
	to   { transform: rotate(360deg); opacity: 0.2; }
}

.soundcite-loaded {
    border-radius: 6px;
    padding: 0 5px 0 5px;
    display: inline-block;
    cursor: pointer;
}

.soundcite-loaded:before {
    display: inline-block;
    content: "";
    vertical-align: -10%;
    margin-right: 0.25em;
}

.soundcite-loading:before {
    margin-right: 0.5em;
    font-size: 0.9em;
    position: relative;
    top: -.05em;
    height: 0.75em;    
    width: 0.75em;
    border: 2px solid #000;
    border-right-color: transparent;
    border-radius: 50%;
    -webkit-animation: spin 1s linear infinite;
    -moz-animation: spin 1s linear infinite;
    -ms-animation: spin 1s linear infinite;
    -o-animation: spin 1s linear infinite;
    animation: spin 1s linear infinite;
}

.soundcite-play:before {
    font-size: 0.9em;
    position: relative;
    top: -.05em;
    border: 0.5em solid transparent;
    border-left: 0.75em solid black;
}

.soundcite-pause:before {
    font-size: 0.9em;
    position: relative;
    top: -.05em;
    height: 1em;
    border-left: .75em double black;
    border-right: .5em solid transparent;
}

",

        "$:/plugins/fk/soundcite/installation": {
            "title": "$:/plugins/fk/soundcite/installation",
            "created": "20200916000000000",
            "text": "!! Install with plugin library (recommended)

# Drag and drop [[$:/config/SoundCitePluginLibrary]] to your wiki
# Open [[$:/ControlPanel]] in your wiki
# Click on the //Plugins// tab
# Click on the //Get more plugins// button
# Under the //SoundCite Plugin Library// tab click //open plugin library//
# Click //install// on the SoundCite plugin

!! Install without plugin library

Drag the following link to your TiddlyWiki: [[$:/plugins/fk/soundcite]]

!! General remarks

Save your TiddlyWiki and reload the page after importing.

This plugin turns off Camel Case Wiki Links. If that doesn't work for some occasion, it can be done manually by setting `$:/config/WikiParserRules/Inline/wikilink` to `disable`.
"
        },
        "$:/plugins/fk/soundcite/macros": {
            "title": "$:/plugins/fk/soundcite/macros",
            "tags": "$:/tags/Macro",
            "created": "20200610000000000",
            "modified": "20200614000000000",
            "text": "\define soundcite-init()
<<script>>
<script type="text/javascript">
    var soundcite_elements = document.getElementsByClassName("soundcite");
    for(var i = 0; i < soundcite_elements.length; i++) {
        var el = soundcite_elements[i];
        if (typeof soundcite !== "undefined" && !el.classList.contains("soundcite-loaded")) {
            if(el.getAttribute('data-url')) {
                new soundcite.PopcornClip(el);
            } else if (el.getAttribute("data-id")) {
                new soundcite.SoundCloudClip(el);
            } else {
                console.log('Unable to form Soundcite element because of missing attributes. The offending Soundcite was "' + el.textContent + '".');
                console.log(el);
            }
        }
    }
</script>
<<script 0>>
\end

\define soundcite(url text:"Play" plays:"1" start:"0" end)
<$set name="text-with-spaces" value={{{[enlist:raw<__text__>join[ ]]}}}>
<$set name="optional-end-attr" filter="[<__end__>!compare:string:eq[]]" value={{{[<__end__>addprefix[data-end="]addsuffix["]]}}} emptyValue="">
<$set name="span" value={{{[[<span class="soundcite" data-url="]append<__url__>append["]join[]append[data-start="]join[ ]append<__start__>append["]join[]append[data-plays="]join[ ]append<__plays__>append["]join[]append<optional-end-attr>join[ ]append[>]append<text-with-spaces>append[</span>]join[]]}}}>
<$wikify name="rendered-span" mode="inline" text=<<span>> output="html">
<<rendered-span>>
</$wikify>
<<soundcite-init>>
</$set>
</$set>
</$set>
\end

\define soundcite-pause-all-js()
<<script>>
<script type="text/javascript">
    if (typeof soundcite !== "undefined") {
        soundcite.pause_all_clips();
    }
</script>
<<script 0>>
\end

\define soundcite-pause-all-action()
<$action-createtiddler $basetitle="$:/state/fk/soundcite/pause-all-state" $savetitle="$:/temp/fk/soundcite/pause-all-state-current" text=<<soundcite-pause-all-js>>/>
\end

\define soundcite-pause-all-button()
<$button actions=<<soundcite-pause-all-action>> tooltip="Pause all inline audios" tag="span" style="border-radius: 50%;border: 0.2em solid #666;padding: 5px;">@@font-size:0.9em;position:relative;top:-.05em;left:0.25em;height:1em;border-left:.75em double black;border-right:.5em solid transparent;<$transclude tiddler={{$:/temp/fk/soundcite/pause-all-state-current}}/>@@</$button>
\end
"
        },
        "$:/plugins/fk/soundcite/readme": {
            "title": "$:/plugins/fk/soundcite/readme",
            "created": "20200610000000000",
            "text": "[[SoundCite|https://soundcite.knightlab.com/]] is an inline audio player embedded behind text. This plugin makes SoundCite v0.5.1 (2017-07-10) available as a macro.
"
        },
        "$:/.tb/macros/script": {
            "title": "$:/.tb/macros/script",
            "created": "20150129001857442",
            "creator": "Tobias Beer",
            "modified": "20150129192206415",
            "modifier": "Tobias Beer",
            "module-type": "macro",
            "type": "application/javascript",
            "description": "source: https://tobibeer.github.io/tw/enable-js/#%24%3A%2F.tb%2Fmacros%2Fscript",
            "text": "(function(){

/*jslint node: true, browser: true */
/*global $tw: false */
"use strict";

/*
enables js via <<script>> and disables with <<script 0>>
*/

exports.name = "script";

exports.params = [
	{name: "run"},
];

/*
Run the macro
*/
exports.run = function(run) {
        var off = run ? run.toLowerCase() : false;
	if(off && ["0","no","off","false"].indexOf(off) > -1) {
		$tw.config.htmlUnsafeElements = ["script"];
	} else {
		$tw.config.htmlUnsafeElements = [];
	}
return "";
};
})();
"
        },
        "$:/plugins/fk/soundcite/usage": {
            "title": "$:/plugins/fk/soundcite/usage",
            "created": "20200610000000000",
            "modified": "20200613000000000",
            "text": "!! `soundcite` macro example

The `soundcite` macro takes fives parameters of which four are optional. The `url` may be either relative, e. g. `files/Beethoven.ogg`, or absolute, e. g. `https://example.org/files/Beethoven.ogg`.

Embedding it as follows...

```
<<soundcite url:"https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/e/ee/Beet5mov1bars1to5.ogg" text:"This">> is only the beginning.
```

...yields...

<<soundcite url:"https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/e/ee/Beet5mov1bars1to5.ogg" text:"This">> is only the beginning.

!! `soundcite` macro parameters

|!#|!Parameter|!Description|!Default|
|1|url|URL to MP3, M4A, WAV or Ogg audio file|(none)|
|2|text|overlayed text|`Play`|
|3|plays|number of loops|`1`|
|4|start|start time in milliseconds|`0`|
|5|end|end time in milliseconds|(stop playback at the end)|

!! Tips & tricks

//according to the SoundCite website//

* Keep it brief! Long clips distract from the story.
* Select your link text carefully. Try not to use so much text that it wraps to two lines.
* Remember you don't have to cut up your audio file. SoundCite can serve multiple segments from a single source.

!! Pause-all button

The `soundcite-pause-all-button` macro provides a button that pauses everything when clicked:

```
<<soundcite-pause-all-button>>
```

...yields...

<<soundcite-pause-all-button>>

To add the button to your page toolbar, write the following to a tiddler tagged `$:/tags/PageControls`:

```
@@font-size:0.5em;vertical-align: middle;<<soundcite-pause-all-button>>@@
```
"
        }
    }
}
